bibl.author: William Stansberry
bibl.title: William Stansberry to Walt Whitman, 28 June 1874
bibl.orgName: Trent Collection of Whitmaniana, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

body.p:
I Receiviedreceived your kind & Most Welcome Letter A Short time A goago And I Have Received 22 News PappersNewspapers And It is Hard For me to tell you How thankful I am to you for them. I Wonder How you Could think what was So Gratifying to us. Well My Health I But VerryVery little Better But If I Had Stayed In W VaWest Virginia I dontdon't Suppose I would Have Been LiveingLiving Now. I am Sorry to know your Health is So Poor But I whishwish you would come to Minnesota and I do think
you would get your Health Better. theirthere is People comeingcoming From Almost Every State to Howard Lake For their Health. Dear Friend you Said In your Letter PrehapsPerhaps We Would Meet knowno more In this world But I Do feel As this PleashurePleasure will Come to me Before I Leave this world A PleashurePleasure I do So MutchMuch Desire For I think My Joy would BeeBe unspeakable to Meet a Friend that was So good & kind to me As you was when I was In Washington. But I Hope If We Do Not Meet In this world we will meet In Heaven.
Being In the army & LoosingLosing My Health So I am Not Able to work of CorseCourse we are Poor But when I went In the army I had a Comfortable Home Was a good Lover

My Mother LeivesLives In W VaWest Virginia My Father Is Dead Tongue Can Not Express How Much I think of My Mother And well I would Like to See Her I Have Not Seen Her For 8 year My Brothers & Sisters Lives theirthere too
I Will Close My letter By Saying I Hope you will get your Health
My Wife Sends Her Best Respects to you And Says tell you She thanks you for your kindness And Care to me
My Children Sends their Love to you Now My Dear Friend I Hope you will write Soon

postscript.p: My Parents Came From New Jersey Not Far From Camden they was Born theirthere
